Jen was happy when Jen was able to buy the bag.
responses:
Dawn and Joyce went for a walk on a crisp Saturday morning. The sun was shining, and the air was fresh, but their conversation was soon interrupted by Jen's confession: she had been eyeing a new bag and was determined to get it. As they strolled along, the sky suddenly darkened, and it started raining hard. They quickened their pace, but it wasn't long before they realized the bag Jen wanted was too expensive.

The downpour was relentless, and Dawn and Joyce took off running to seek shelter. They finally reached their house, cold, wet, and shivering. Jen, meanwhile, was left to ponder her desire for the bag. She decided then and there to start saving up, determined to make her dream a reality.

The next few weeks were a struggle. Dawn and Joyce had to change their clothes multiple times a day, as the rain showed no signs of letting up. But Jen was resolute in her determination. She took on extra hours at work, pouring every extra penny into her savings account.

And then, one day, it happened. Jen's hard work paid off, and she finally had enough money to buy the bag. She was over the moon with excitement, and Dawn and Joyce were thrilled for her. As they sat in the park, watching Jen proudly show off her new purchase, they all agreed that sometimes, perseverance and determination can make even the most impossible dreams come true.

outline: Tim got a new cat.
John had never raced cars professionally before.
The cat always ran from Tim.
John was excited for his first race.
Tim bought a bright ball of yarn.
John didn't come close to winning.
The cat was curious.
John was just glad John got all the way through it.
Then Tim and Tim's cat played with the yarn together.
John knew it was a good first step and continued.
responses:
Tim had just brought home a new cat, and he was excited to show it off to his friend John. But as soon as John came over, the cat darted out of the room, and Tim laughed, "I guess I should've warned you, my cat always runs from me!" John chuckled and said, "Well, I'm not going to let that deter me from getting excited for my first car race. I've never done it professionally before, but I'm ready for it!"

As they headed out to the track, Tim decided to buy a bright ball of yarn to distract the cat while he was away. Meanwhile, John took off, his heart racing with anticipation. But as he crossed the finish line, he realized he didn't come close to winning. He was a bit disappointed, but relieved to have finished the race without any major mishaps.

When he got back home, Tim was playing with his curious cat, who was batting at the yarn. John joined in, laughing at the sight of the two of them having so much fun. "Well, I may not have won the race," he said, "but I'm just glad I got all the way through it." Tim nodded in agreement, and the two friends spent the rest of the evening playing with the cat and yarn.

John left soon after, but as he walked away, he thought to himself, "That was a good first step, and I'll continue to work on improving my skills. Maybe next time I'll be the one to beat." With renewed determination, he headed home, already looking forward to the next race.

outline: Annie remembered standing at this same quilt show last year.
Daniel loves filling the bird feeders at his home.
This time around, Annie had a quilt on display.
Daniel enjoys seeing the wide variety of birds that they attract.
Annie reflected on all Annie had experienced and accomplished.
The birds glare at Daniel through the window if they are not fed.
The judging had just finished.
When Daniel fills the feeders, the birds alert their friends by chirping.
Annie had earned an honorable mention ribbon.
After fresh food is supplied, Daniel loves seeing the birds so happy.
responses:
Annie stood at the quilt show, her eyes scanning the vibrant displays of handmade masterpieces. She remembered standing at this same show last year, marveling at the intricate stitches and colors. This time, however, she had a quilt of her own on display, and she felt a sense of pride and accomplishment.

As she admired her quilt, Annie's mind wandered to all she had experienced and accomplished over the past year. She had learned new skills, taken risks, and made progress on her goals. The quilt show was a celebration of her hard work and dedication.

Just then, Daniel, a fellow quilter and Annie's friend, approached her. He loved filling the bird feeders at his home and watching the variety of birds that they attracted. In fact, he enjoyed it so much that the birds would glare at him through the window if they didn't get their food on time.

Annie and Daniel chatted about the show, and she told him that the judging had just finished. She had earned an honorable mention ribbon, which she was thrilled about. Daniel congratulated her, and they decided to take a break and grab some fresh air.

As they walked outside, Daniel reached into his pocket and pulled out some birdseed. "Time to fill the feeders," he said with a smile. Annie watched as he scattered the seed, and the birds began to chirp excitedly, alerting their friends to the fresh food.

Daniel loved seeing the birds so happy when they had been fed, and Annie couldn't help but feel a sense of joy watching them flutter around the yard. It was a simple pleasure, but one that brought her friend a great deal of delight.

As they stood there, Annie reflected on her accomplishments and the people she had met along the way. She felt grateful for the experiences and relationships that had enriched her life. And as she looked at Daniel, filling the bird feeders with a sense of purpose, she knew that she was exactly where she was meant to be.

outline: Tina had a paper due in two hours.
Tom was at the mall.
Only problem was Tina did not start it yet.
Tom went into a store and the alarm went off.
Tina then worked very hard for those two hours.
Something Tom was wearing set it off.
To Tina's delight Tina got a great grade in the end.
On the way out an employee asked Tom some questions.
Tina could not believe it.
It was clear Tom hadn't stolen and Tom went on Tom's way.
responses:
Tina stared at the blank page in front of her, her mind racing with the task at hand. She had a paper due in just two hours, and she hadn't even started writing yet. Panic began to set in as she thought about the consequences of not meeting the deadline.

Meanwhile, Tom was at the mall, browsing through the stores. As he entered a popular clothing store, the alarm suddenly went off, and the employee rushed out to investigate. It turned out that something Tom was wearing had set off the security system.

Back at home, Tina threw herself into her work, determined to get the paper done in time. She poured all her energy into writing, and to her delight, the words flowed effortlessly. Two hours later, she finally finished, feeling a sense of accomplishment and relief.

As Tom left the store, the employee approached him, asking a few questions about the item he was wearing. Tom patiently answered the questions, and it soon became clear that he hadn't stolen anything. The employee apologized and thanked Tom for his cooperation.

Tina couldn't believe her good fortune when she received an A grade on her paper. She had done it! She felt proud of herself for pushing through the pressure and meeting the deadline.

Tom, on the other hand, went on his way, feeling a bit embarrassed but relieved that the situation had been resolved. As he walked out of the mall, he couldn't help but think about the irony of the situation - he had almost been accused of theft, all because of something he was wearing.

outline: Jamie works almost 7 days a week at his job.
Adam was expecting an important phone call.
The only thing Jamie has ever wanted was a Jeep Wrangler.
Adam carried Adam's phone with Adam all day.
Jamie went home after work on his birthday, his wife was waiting for him.
Adam was surprised in the evening nobody called.
Jamie's wife stood beside a brand new Jeep with a giant bow on it!
Adam checked Adam's phone.
Jamie was so excited, Jamie couldn't wait to go for a ride with Jamie's wife.
It was on silent mode.
responses:
Jamie trudged home from work, exhausted from another long day. It was his birthday, but he wouldn't have noticed if his wife hadn't been waiting for him at the door with a big smile. As he walked in, she surprised him with a brand new Jeep Wrangler, adorned with a giant bow. Jamie's eyes widened with excitement - it was the only thing he had ever really wanted.

Just then, Adam, who had been carrying his phone with him all day, walked in and handed it to his friend Jamie. "Hey, I was expecting an important call today," Adam said, looking puzzled. Jamie barely noticed, too busy admiring his new ride.

As the evening wore on, Adam couldn't help but notice that Jamie seemed more excited than usual. "What's going on?" he asked, but Jamie just grinned and said he was too busy celebrating his birthday. Adam shrugged and checked his phone, wondering who could have forgotten to call.

As Jamie and his wife prepared to take the Jeep out for a spin, Jamie was practically bouncing with excitement. "Can we go now? Please?" he begged. His wife laughed and handed him the keys. As they drove off, Adam watched them go, still puzzled by the lack of phone calls. It wasn't until later, when he checked his phone again, that he realized it had been on silent mode all day. Ah, no wonder he hadn't heard from anyone. Adam shook his head, chuckling to himself. It was going to be a long night.

outline: Lisa turned thirty-five last weekend.
Becky wanted to impress her pals.
Lisa's friends threw Lisa surprise birthday party.
Becky showed her pals her dad's prized collection of rocks.
Everyone that was close to Lisa attended.
When Becky's pals begged, Becky let Becky's pals each keep a rock.
The party became a little too loud and police were called.
The pals left, and Becky looked at the empty spaces in her dad's collection.
Lisa will never forget this birthday party.
Becky walked along the road picking up rocks to fill the spaces.
responses:
Lisa turned thirty-five last weekend, and her friends threw her a surprise birthday party. Becky, one of her closest friends, wanted to impress her pals and decided to show them her dad's prized collection of rocks. Everyone who was close to Lisa attended the party, and when Becky's pals begged, she let them each keep a rock as a party favor.

As the night wore on, the party became a little too loud, and the police were called to request that the noise be kept down. Despite the interruption, the party continued, but eventually, Becky's pals said their goodbyes and left. As the house emptied, Becky looked at the empty spaces in her dad's collection, feeling a pang of sadness.

Lisa, however, would never forget this birthday party. Despite the chaos and the police visit, it was a day filled with laughter and love. As she reflected on the celebration, she felt grateful for her friends and the memories they had made together.

Becky, on the other hand, was left with a task. She walked along the road, picking up rocks to fill the spaces in her dad's collection. As she wandered, she thought about her dad and the stories he had told her about each of the rocks. She imagined him smiling, knowing that his prized collection was once again complete. As she returned home, Becky felt a sense of peace, knowing that she had honored her dad's legacy and kept his memory alive.

outline: John was alone and did not know what to do.
Annie remembered standing at this same quilt show last year.
John decided to make a snowman.
This time around, Annie had a quilt on display.
John gave the snowman a cool hat.
Annie reflected on all Annie had experienced and accomplished.
Then John gave the snowman a huge smile.
The judging had just finished.
At last John did not feel alone anymore!
Annie had earned an honorable mention ribbon.
responses:
John trudged through the snow-covered field, his boots crunching on the frozen crystals. He was alone, with no clear direction or purpose. The quilt show behind him was a blur of colors and patterns, but none of it seemed to hold any significance. As he looked around, he spotted a small patch of snow untainted by the earlier winter weather. On a whim, he decided to build a snowman.

As he worked on his creation, a familiar face caught his eye. Annie was standing a short distance away, gazing intently at a quilt draped over a nearby table. John's mind wandered back to last year's quilt show, where he had seen Annie's incredible work on display. He had been impressed by her talent then, and it seemed she was back again this year.

With his snowman taking shape, John decided to add a finishing touch – a cool hat to keep his frosty friend warm. As he placed the hat on the snowman's head, Annie noticed his creation and smiled. She was reflecting on all she had experienced and accomplished, feeling proud of her quilt and the recognition it had received.

The judges had just finished their deliberations, and the atmosphere was electric with excitement. Annie's quilt had earned an honorable mention ribbon, and she beamed with pride as she accepted the award. John, too, felt a sense of accomplishment as he gazed at his snowman, which now sported a huge smile. Something about the snowman's cheerful visage resonated with him, and he felt a sense of companionship wash over him.

At last, John did not feel alone anymore. He and Annie struck up a conversation, bonding over their shared love of quilting and snowmen. As they chatted, John realized that sometimes it takes a little bit of snow and a lot of heart to find companionship in the most unexpected places.

outline: John realized he had a midterm exam tomorrow.
Brent was in love with Joanna
John had not studied one bit for this exam.
Joanna's family did not like Brent but they felt Brent was not a good man.
John started cramming for the exam.
One day brent helped Joanna sneak out of the house but Joanna got caught.
John studied for hours into the night.
Brent was no longer allowed to see Joanna but Brent knew Brent was wrong.
John barely passed John's midterm that morning.
Joanna eventually met a good man and got married.
responses:
John was in a panic. He had just realized that his midterm exam was tomorrow, and he hadn't studied a single bit. He had been putting it off, thinking he could cram everything in at the last minute. But now, with the exam looming over him, he knew he had to get to work.

As he delved into his textbooks and notes, John couldn't help but think of his friend Brent, who was head over heels in love with Joanna. Brent had always been a bit of a troublemaker, and John knew that Joanna's family didn't approve of him. In fact, they thought he was a bad influence on their daughter.

But Brent had a good heart, and he would do anything for Joanna. One day, he helped her sneak out of the house, thinking he was doing her a favor. However, Joanna got caught, and her family was furious.

Meanwhile, John was studying for hours on end, trying to absorb as much information as possible. He barely looked up from his books, too focused on making sure he passed his exam.

The night wore on, and John finally felt like he had a good grasp on the material. As he packed up his things to head to bed, he couldn't help but think about Brent and Joanna. He knew that Brent was no longer allowed to see Joanna, and it was all because of his own mistakes.

The next morning, John walked into the exam room feeling a mix of nerves and exhaustion. He barely passed, but he was relieved it was over.

Years went by, and John lost touch with Brent and Joanna. But one day, he heard that Joanna had met a good man and gotten married. John was happy for her, knowing that she deserved someone who would treat her right.

As for Brent, John never saw him again, but he hoped that his friend had learned from his mistakes and had moved on to better things.

outline: Jeremy went to his parents house to gather things from his childhood.
Anna went on a class trip.
In the basement Jeremy found old jars of playdough.
Anna went to Thailand and Malaysia.
Jeremy tried to play with it but they were solid as a rock.
Anna had jet lag, but quickly overcame it.
Jeremy threw the jars away in the trash.
Then Anna explored the sights with her classmates.
Jeremy went home and bought fresh playdough to replace the old stuff.
Anna had an amazing time!
responses:
Jeremy stood in his childhood bedroom, surrounded by memories of his youth. He had come to his parents' house to gather some things from his past, relics of a bygone era. As he rummaged through his old toy box, he stumbled upon a dusty old trunk in the basement. Amidst the forgotten treasures, he found a collection of jars filled with playdough.

Jeremy's eyes lit up as he recalled the countless hours he spent playing with the squishy, colorful substance. He eagerly opened one of the jars, expecting to be greeted by the familiar softness. However, to his dismay, the playdough inside was as hard as a rock. Undeterred, Jeremy tried to play with it, but it was clear that the old playdough was beyond revival.

Meanwhile, Anna was on a class trip to Thailand and Malaysia. As she explored the vibrant streets and tried new foods, she struggled to adjust to the time difference. But with each passing day, her jet lag began to dissipate, and she found herself growing more and more energized.

After returning home, Anna regaled her classmates with stories of her adventures. As they walked through the sights, she marveled at the stunning architecture and bustling markets. Despite the long flights and early wake-up calls, Anna had an amazing time exploring the exotic lands.

Back at his parents' house, Jeremy decided to throw away the old, unusable playdough. As he trudged upstairs to the trash, he couldn't shake the feeling that he was letting go of a piece of his childhood. But he knew that it was time to move on.

Feeling nostalgic, Jeremy made a trip to the store and bought a fresh batch of playdough. As he opened the package and began to knead the soft, squishy material, he felt a sense of joy and contentment wash over him. It was a small but significant step towards embracing his present and looking forward to his future.

Anna, too, was reflecting on her recent travels. As she settled back into her routine, she realized that the experience had left her with a newfound appreciation for the world and its many wonders. And though she was happy to be home, she knew that she would always treasure the memories of her amazing time in Thailand and Malaysia.

outline: Billy was walking in the grass barefoot.
Mike turned 21 Year's old one summer day.
Billy got a thorn in his foot.
When Mike woke up, Mike put on some clothes and left Mike's house.
Billy screamed in pain.
Mike drove down to the local grocery store and bought some beers.
Billy tried to get it out but Billy couldn't.
Mike was very nervous to go home and actually try one.
Billy's mother finally pulled it out with tweezers.
When Mike finally got home, Mike drank the alcohol but became too drunk.
responses:
Billy was walking in the grass barefoot, enjoying the warm summer day. Meanwhile, his friend Mike was celebrating his 21st birthday, having just woken up and put on some clothes. As Billy continued his stroll, he felt a sudden sharp pain in his foot. He let out a loud scream, clutching at his foot in agony.

Mike, still feeling celebratory, decided to drive down to the local grocery store to buy some beers. Billy, still writhing in pain, tried to remove the thorn from his foot, but it was stuck too deep. Just then, Billy's mother appeared, tweezers in hand, and gently plucked out the offending thorn.

Mike returned home, beers in hand, but was feeling increasingly nervous about trying one. He had always been wary of drinking, but today was his 21st birthday, after all. Billy, still nursing his wounded foot, watched with amusement as Mike hesitated.

Finally, Mike took a deep breath and popped open a cold beer. But as he took his first sip, he quickly realized he was in over his head. The beer was stronger than he had anticipated, and before long he was stumbling around the room, too drunk to stand.

Billy, chuckling at his friend's misfortune, lay back on the couch, his throbbing foot forgotten in the face of Mike's antics. As the night wore on, Mike continued to stumble and stagger, eventually collapsing onto the floor, surrounded by empty beer cans. Billy just shook his head, laughing, and wondered what the rest of the night would bring.

outline: Kate watched the lotto drawing and checked her ticket.
Allie was driving only five miles above the limit.
Kate was shocked to find that Kate had won!
All the sudden Allie got pulled over.
Kate rushed to the lottery office to claim Kate's winnings.
When Allie saw the cop she was awestruck.
But there, Kate learned that Kate had heard the number wrong.
The cop was very beautiful.
Kate had not won the jackpot after all.
Thankfully the cop let Allie go with a warning.
responses:
Kate watched the lotto drawing on TV, her heart racing with excitement as she checked her ticket. Allie, her best friend, was driving home from work, speeding just five miles above the limit. Unbeknownst to Allie, Kate had purchased a ticket for her as a joke.

As Kate checked her ticket, her eyes widened in shock - she had won! She rushed to the lottery office to claim the prize, barely containing her excitement. Meanwhile, Allie was pulled over by a handsome cop, who looked stunning in his uniform. Allie was awestruck, her speeding forgotten in the face of his good looks.

At the lottery office, Kate learned to her dismay that she had misheard the winning numbers. She had not won the jackpot after all. Feeling deflated, Kate decided to share the news with Allie at the cop's office. Thankfully, the cop, still beautiful, decided to let Allie off with a warning. As they left the office, Kate couldn't help but laugh at the absurdity of it all. Sometimes, even when life doesn't turn out as expected, a beautiful cop and a good laugh can make it all worthwhile.

outline: Brent was in love with Joanna
James was playing video names when he got a bloody nose.
Joanna's family did not like Brent but they felt Brent was not a good man.
The blood came out quickly, staining James' jeans.
One day brent helped Joanna sneak out of the house but Joanna got caught.
When the bleeding stopped James was left to deal with the mess.
Brent was no longer allowed to see Joanna but Brent knew Brent was wrong.
Nothing seemed to get the blood out of James' pants.
Joanna eventually met a good man and got married.
Luckily, James' mom took the pants and somehow fixed them.
responses:
Brent was hopelessly in love with Joanna, but her family didn't approve of him. They thought he was a bad influence, and Brent knew they were right. Despite this, he couldn't resist her charms and often found himself sneaking around to be with her.

One day, James was engrossed in his favorite video game when he got a bloody nose. The blood flowed freely, staining his jeans a deep crimson. He was left to deal with the mess, as the bleeding eventually stopped, leaving him with a pair of pants that seemed to be beyond salvation.

Around this time, Brent helped Joanna sneak out of the house, but she got caught. Her family's disapproval of Brent was solidified, and he was no longer allowed to see her. But Brent knew he was wrong and that his love for Joanna was misguided.

James, meanwhile, was struggling to get the bloodstains out of his pants. No matter what he tried, the stubborn red marks refused to fade. His mom eventually took pity on him and, with a bit of magic, managed to fix the pants.

As for Joanna, she eventually left her family's disapproval behind and met a good man who loved her for who she was. The two of them got married, and Brent was left to nurse his broken heart.

In the end, James' mom's TLC had saved his pants, but Brent's love for Joanna had been left to wither away, a cautionary tale about the dangers of loving someone who was bad for you.

outline: Tonya was out shopping with her little girl, Kelsie.
Randy was eating his favorite steak.
Kelsie saw a bike Kelsie wanted and Tonya agreed to buy it.
While eating Randy felt a pain in his chest.
Kelsie couldn't wait to get home to ride Kelsie's bike up and down the street.
Randy grabbed his chest and fell to the floor.
When Tonya was ready to pay for it, Tonya was ten dollars short.
Randy's kids came over to check on Randy.
The person in line behind Tonya paid for the bike and Tonya cried.
They rushed Randy to the hospital where Randy made a full recovery.
responses:
Tonya was out shopping with her little girl, Kelsie, on a sunny Saturday morning. As they strolled through the aisles, Kelsie's eyes landed on a shiny new bike that caught her eye. Tonya couldn't resist her daughter's excitement and agreed to buy the bike.

Meanwhile, Randy was enjoying his favorite steak at a nearby restaurant. As he took a bite, he suddenly felt a sharp pain in his chest. He grabbed his chest and fell to the floor, alarming the other diners.

Back at the store, Kelsie was practically bouncing with excitement, eager to get home and ride her new bike up and down the street. Tonya was busy trying to convince the cashier to let her pay by credit card, but it seemed she was ten dollars short.

Just as Tonya was about to give up, the person in line behind her noticed her distress and kindly offered to cover the remaining amount. Tonya was visibly shaken, tears welling up in her eyes as she thanked the stranger.

As they left the store, Tonya's husband Randy's kids arrived, concerned about their father's sudden collapse. They rushed to his side, and together they called an ambulance. Randy was rushed to the hospital, where doctors quickly diagnosed a minor heart attack.

Despite the scare, Randy made a full recovery and was back on his feet in no time. Tonya was overjoyed, and the family celebrated with a big dinner, complete with Kelsie's new bike parked safely in the garage.

outline: Julie was looking for some extra spending money.
Cameron went to the playground.
Julie decided to open up a lemonade stand.
Cameron noticed that one of Cameron's friends was crying.
To Julie's delight the stand became quite popular.
Cameron asked his friend if he could help his friend.
The neighbors wanted to get a taste.
Cameron's friend wanted to play on the see-saw.
At the end of the day Julie made 100 dollars.
Cameron agreed to help Cameron's friend by playing on the see-saw.
responses:
Julie was on the lookout for some extra spending money, so she decided to set up a lemonade stand in front of her house. To her delight, the stand became incredibly popular, with people of all ages stopping by to quench their thirst. Meanwhile, Cameron had gone to the playground, where he noticed one of his friends crying. Feeling empathetic, Cameron asked his friend if he could help him feel better.

Just then, a group of neighbors walked by and caught the enticing aroma of Julie's freshly squeezed lemonade. They eagerly asked Julie if they could get a taste, and she happily obliged. As the neighbors sipped their drinks, Cameron's friend, still sniffling, exclaimed that he wanted to play on the see-saw. Cameron, still trying to comfort his friend, agreed to play with him on the swings, helping his friend forget his troubles.

As the day wore on, Julie's lemonade stand continued to thrive, and by the end of the day, she had made a whopping 100 dollars. As she packed up her stand, she couldn't help but feel grateful for the unexpected success and the joy it brought to everyone who stopped by. And Cameron, still playing on the see-saw with his friend, beamed with happiness, knowing that he had made a difference in someone's day.

outline: Betty wanted to lose weight.
Mickey wanted strawberry ice cream.
Betty tried dieting, but that failed.
The ice cream shop was out of strawberry ice cream.
Betty was unable to give up Betty's favorite sweets .
Mickey had to choose between chocolate and vanilla.
Then Betty had a better idea!
Mickey decided on chocolate.
Betty began walking an hour a day and lost 25 pounds quickly.
Mickey was less than satisfied with Mickey's ice cream.
responses:
Betty had been struggling with her weight for a while, and she was determined to lose it. She tried dieting, but unfortunately, it didn't work out for her. Despite her best efforts, she couldn't seem to give up her favorite sweets.

On a hot summer day, Mickey asked her if she wanted to grab some ice cream with him. Betty's eyes lit up at the thought of a cold, creamy treat. Mickey's eyes sparkled as well, and he exclaimed, "I want strawberry ice cream!"

However, when they arrived at the ice cream shop, they were disappointed to find out that they were out of strawberry ice cream. Mickey was devastated, and Betty tried to console him. She suggested they try chocolate or vanilla instead, but Mickey was adamant that strawberry was the only way to go.

As they were about to leave, Betty had a better idea. She suggested that they walk off their disappointment by taking a stroll around the block. Mickey agreed, and as they walked, Betty mentioned that she had been thinking about starting a walking routine to help with her weight loss.

Mickey was intrigued, and soon they found themselves walking an hour a day, exploring new neighborhoods and enjoying the fresh air. Betty was thrilled to see the pounds melting off, and soon she had lost 25 pounds. Mickey was impressed by her dedication and progress.

But, as their walking routine continued, Mickey found himself craving something sweet again. He decided to satisfy his craving with a cone of chocolate ice cream. While it was delicious, he was less than satisfied with his choice. He realized that strawberry would have been better, but he was also grateful for the new perspective on treats that their walking routine had given them.

As they sat on a bench, licking their cones, Betty smiled contentedly. She was proud of herself for taking control of her health, and she was grateful for Mickey's support. Mickey smiled back, feeling happy that he had found a new appreciation for the simple joys in life, like a walk and a sweet treat.

outline: Corey got a new job which brought more stress than he was used to.
Sam ran out of gas.
Corey wanted to keep working but needed a way to deal with the stress.
Sam was also wanting a drink.
Corey's friend suggested that Corey start practicing meditation.
Sam only had enough money for either beer or gasoline.
Corey researched meditation techniques and found one that worked.
Sam decided to get the gasoline and wait on the beer.
Corey became much less stressed and was happy to keep working.
It was a smart choice and Sam was proud of Sam.
responses:
Corey trudged home from his new job, exhausted and overwhelmed by the stress that came with it. His friend, Alex, sensed his distress and asked what was wrong. Corey confided in him about the added pressure, and Alex suggested he try meditation to manage his stress.

Corey was skeptical but decided to give it a shot. He researched various techniques and stumbled upon a method that resonated with him. He committed to practicing daily, and soon he noticed a significant reduction in his stress levels. In fact, he felt more focused and energized, and his newfound calm allowed him to tackle his work with renewed enthusiasm.

Meanwhile, Sam was having a rough day of his own. He was driving home from work when his car sputtered and died – he had run out of gas. With only enough cash for either beer or gasoline, he decided to prioritize the latter. He vowed to wait until payday to treat himself to a cold one.

One evening, as Corey and Sam hung out, Corey mentioned his newfound love for meditation. Sam, still reeling from his own stress, was intrigued and asked Corey to teach him the basics. Corey shared his research and guided Sam through a few exercises. To his surprise, Sam felt a similar sense of calm wash over him.

As they parted ways, Corey reflected on the benefits of meditation and how it had transformed his life. He was grateful for Alex's suggestion and felt proud of himself for taking control of his stress. Sam, too, felt a sense of accomplishment, having made the smart choice to prioritize his car's needs over his own desires.

From that day forward, Corey and Sam would often meet up for meditation sessions, sharing their experiences and encouraging each other to continue their practices. As they sat in silence, they knew they had found a way to manage life's stresses and come out stronger on the other side.

outline: James was playing video names when he got a bloody nose.
Ray worked in the fashion industry.
The blood came out quickly, staining James' jeans.
Every season, Ray needs a new suit to keep up with style.
When the bleeding stopped James was left to deal with the mess.
Last autumn, Ray tried a suit that was radical looking.
Nothing seemed to get the blood out of James' pants.
Ray knew it was a risk to wear it in Ray's industry.
Luckily, James' mom took the pants and somehow fixed them.
The risk paid off, and Ray started a new trend altogether.
responses:
James was engrossed in his favorite video game when he suddenly got a bloody nose. He quickly got up to grab a tissue, but it was too late. The blood had already started to flow, staining his jeans a deep crimson. The bleeding stopped as quickly as it had started, leaving James to deal with the mess.

Feeling frustrated, James decided to take a break and go outside for some fresh air. As he was walking, he ran into his friend Ray, who was on his way to a fashion show. Ray worked in the fashion industry and was known for his impeccable sense of style. James told Ray about his bloody nose and the stained jeans, feeling embarrassed.

Ray, however, was intrigued by James' predicament. He explained that every season, he needed a new suit to keep up with the latest trends. Last autumn, he had tried a radical-looking suit that had taken some getting used to, but it had paid off. The risk he took by wearing it had started a new trend in the industry.

James laughed at the thought of his bloody jeans starting a fashion trend. However, Ray saw something in them that James didn't. He took the jeans from James and promised to return them after he had "fixed" them. James was skeptical, but Ray assured him that his mom, who was a seamstress, would be able to work her magic.

A few days later, James' mom took the jeans and worked her magic. She managed to remove the stubborn stain, leaving the jeans looking like new. James was amazed and thanked his mom for her help.

When James saw Ray again, he asked him about the jeans. Ray told him that he had worn them to a fashion show and had received numerous compliments. The risk he took by wearing the bloody jeans had paid off, and he had started a new trend altogether. James laughed, feeling happy that his mishap had led to something good.

outline: It was Sue's time to renew her cell phone contract.

Sue went into the store and found the phone Sue wanted.
Ronald had no idea what to really expect being sheltered all Ronald's life.
With a new contract Sue's phone was only one dollar.
Ronald's face turned bright red as soon as the teacher started speaking.
Sue happily paid the one dollar and got a new phone case too.
The group giggled but Ronald learned quite a few things.
responses:
Sue was thrilled to be renewing her cell phone contract, and she couldn't wait to get her hands on the latest model. As she walked into the store, she was immediately drawn to the sleek design of the new phone she had been eyeing. She happily found it on the shelf and began to fill out the paperwork to renew her contract.

Meanwhile, Ronald was struggling to keep up in his intro to Anatomy class. As a sheltered person, he had never had much exposure to the human body, and he was overwhelmed by the complex diagrams and terminology. As he sat in class, he found himself grouped with three beautiful women who were all effortlessly understanding the material. Ronald's face turned bright red as the teacher began to speak, and he felt like he was in way over his head.

After class, Sue headed back to the phone store to finalize her purchase. To her surprise, the new phone was only one dollar with her new contract! She happily paid the reduced price and even decided to splurge on a new phone case to go with it.

As Ronald was walking out of class, he couldn't help but notice the group of girls giggling and whispering to each other. He felt a pang of embarrassment, knowing that he was the only one who seemed lost and confused. But as he continued to attend class, he began to learn more about the human body, and his embarrassment slowly turned to excitement. Despite his initial struggles, Ronald discovered that he had a hidden talent for anatomy, and he was grateful to his classmates for helping him along the way.

outline: Doug is drunk.
John realized he had a midterm exam tomorrow.
Doug argues with Doug's son.
John had not studied one bit for this exam.
Doug fights with Doug's son.
John started cramming for the exam.
Doug bloodies the face of Doug's son.
John studied for hours into the night.
Doug gets arrested for Doug's violence.
John barely passed John's midterm that morning.
responses:
Doug stumbled into the living room, his eyes glassy from a night of heavy drinking. His son, still angry from their argument earlier, glared at him from the couch.

"Dad, why do you always do this?" his son asked, exasperated.

Doug didn't respond, too busy trying to focus on the TV. It was then that John, who had been quietly studying in the corner, realized with a start that he had a midterm exam tomorrow. He hadn't studied one bit, and the thought sent a wave of panic through him.

As Doug continued to slur and stumble around the room, his son tried to leave, but Doug blocked his way. "You're not going anywhere, kid," Doug growled, his face twisted in anger.

The argument escalated, and soon the two were physically fighting. Doug's son tried to defend himself, but Doug was too strong. In the end, it was Doug who emerged victorious, but not before bloodying his son's face.

As the police arrived to take Doug away, John couldn't help but feel a sense of relief. He was finally free to focus on his exam. He spent the next few hours cramming, determined to pass.

As the night wore on, John's exhaustion gave way to a sense of determination. He would pass this exam, no matter what. And when he finally stumbled into class the next morning, still bleary-eyed but determined, he was surprised to find that he had barely passed.

As he walked out of the classroom, he couldn't help but think that maybe, just maybe, it was all worth it.

outline: John was a graphic designer.
Fernando wanted to capture the majestic beauty of the Alps.
John decided to use his skills to make phoney coupons.
Fernando bought a ticket to go up the mountain.
John took them to the supermarket and handed them to the cashier.
On top, it was so cold that Fernando's hands were shaking.
The coupons made everything in John's cart free.
When it was time to take the pictures Fernando wanted, Fernando couldn't.
The cashier did not suspect John and accepted all of the coupons.
Fernando all came shaky and unfocused.
responses:
John, a talented graphic designer, had been itching to use his skills for a more mischievous purpose. He decided to create phoney coupons, hoping to get away with a free shopping spree. Meanwhile, Fernando, an avid photographer, was planning a trip to capture the majestic beauty of the Alps.

Fernando bought a ticket to ascend the mountain, eager to reach the summit and snap breathtaking photos. John, who was also an avid hiker, decided to join him on the trip. As they made their way up the mountain, John handed Fernando a stack of coupons. "For the supermarket," he said casually.

At the summit, it was freezing, and Fernando's hands were shaking with the cold. But John's plan was already in motion. He had taken the coupons to the supermarket and handed them to the cashier, who didn't suspect a thing. To their surprise, everything in John's cart was declared free.

As the sun began to set, Fernando pulled out his camera to take the shots he had been waiting for. But his frozen hands made it impossible to focus. John, on the other hand, was thrilled with his haul and couldn't wait to get back to the supermarket to stock up on more goodies.

The cashier, none the wiser, accepted all of the coupons without a second thought. As they made their way back down the mountain, Fernando's photos were a blur, but John's grin remained firmly in place.

outline: Kelly took her sled to the top of the snow-covered hill in the park.
Neil was ending his visit to Germany.
Kelly carefully laid on her belly on the sled.
Neil decided his last sight would be the Black Forest.
Slowly, Kelly pushed herself over the crest of the hill.
Neil took a train ride to the beautiful location.
The sled quickly picked up speed as Kelly glided down the hill.
Neil thought of the German fairy tales set here.
Kelly laughed all the way to the bottom.
Neil thought the forest was spooky, but beautiful nonetheless!
responses:
Kelly took her sled to the top of the snow-covered hill in the park, eager to feel the rush of the cold winter air. Meanwhile, Neil was ending his visit to Germany, taking in the sights and sounds of the country he had grown to love. As he stood at the edge of the Black Forest, he decided that this would be his last sight in Germany - the beautiful, mystical location that had captured his imagination.

Back at the park, Kelly carefully laid on her belly on the sled, feeling the cold snow beneath her. She took a deep breath, preparing herself for the ride of her life. As she pushed herself over the crest of the hill, the sled quickly picked up speed, carrying her down the hill with a joyful whoop.

Neil, meanwhile, took a train ride to the Black Forest, his eyes scanning the snowy landscape for any sign of the magic he had heard so much about. As he walked through the forest, he thought of the German fairy tales set here, imagining the mythical creatures that might be lurking just out of sight.

Down at the bottom of the hill, Kelly laughed all the way to the finish, her cheeks flushed with excitement. She hopped off the sled, grinning from ear to ear. Neil, on the other hand, thought the forest was spooky, but beautiful nonetheless, the trees looming above him like sentinels. Despite the eerie atmosphere, he couldn't help but feel a sense of wonder at the natural beauty that surrounded him. As he made his way back to the train, he knew that this was a memory he would treasure forever.

outline: Gina wanted a brand new desk like the new boy in her class.
Tom was a rookie hiker who decided to hike by himself.
Gina wanted to ask her teacher, but Gina was helping another student.
Tom was having a great time on a hike Tom had done many times.
As Gina waited, other students were discussing the new desk.
Losing track of time, the sun went down, leaving Tom in darkness.
Gina hadn't realized anyone else felt the same way Gina did.
Tom was lost, because everything looked much different at night.
Gina knew if Gina didn't ask first, Gina wouldn't be getting a new desk.
Eventually, Tom found his way home by following the north star.
responses:
Gina gazed longingly at the new boy in her class, who sported a sleek, high-tech desk that she coveted. She wanted one just like it, and her mind was consumed with thoughts of how to get her hands on it. Meanwhile, Tom, a rookie hiker, decided to tackle a familiar trail on his own, eager to enjoy the solitude and peacefulness of nature.

As Gina waited for her turn to ask her teacher for help with a math problem, she couldn't help but overhear her classmates discussing the new desk. They all seemed to want one, and Gina felt a surge of determination to get hers. But as she waited, she realized that she didn't want to ask her teacher just yet, as another student was already receiving assistance.

Tom, on the other hand, was having the time of his life on the hike. He had done this trail many times before, but today it seemed even more beautiful and serene. However, as the sun began to set, he lost track of time and soon found himself surrounded by darkness.

Back in class, Gina was still waiting for her turn, but she was getting anxious. She had almost given up hope when she overheard a classmate whispering about the new desk again. This time, it clicked – Gina realized that she wasn't the only one who wanted one. She felt a spark of excitement and determination, knowing that she needed to act fast if she wanted to get her hands on the coveted desk.

Meanwhile, Tom was struggling to find his way back. The darkness had made everything look unfamiliar, and he was starting to feel a sense of panic. He knew that he had to stay calm and think clearly, so he took a deep breath and looked up at the night sky. There, he spotted the north star shining brightly, and he knew that it would lead him home.

As the night wore on, Gina finally got her chance to ask her teacher for help, and she seized it. She explained her desire for a new desk, and to her surprise, her teacher agreed that it would be a great idea. Gina left the classroom feeling elated, knowing that she would soon be sporting a brand-new desk just like the new boy's.

In the end, both Gina and Tom had overcome their challenges and achieved their goals. Gina had gotten her new desk, and Tom had found his way home. As they both drifted off to sleep that night, they couldn't help but feel grateful for the unexpected twists and turns that had led them to success.

outline: Ted had finals coming up.
Sally and Tommy saw a family of Syrian refugees on TV.
Ted knew that Ted did not study enough this semester.
Sally and Tommy were sad and wanted to help.
Ted stayed up all late all week studying.
Sally and Tommy decided to have a lemonade stand.
When test day came around Ted was so tired Ted slept all day.
Sally and Tommy sold lemonade all day Saturday.
Ted failed all his test, and had to retake all his classes.
Tommy and Sally felt glad Tommy and Sally raised fifty two dollars.
responses:
Ted had been putting off studying for his upcoming finals, knowing that he hadn't prepared enough. Sally and Tommy, who had been watching the news, saw a heartbreaking story about a family of Syrian refugees and were overcome with sadness. They wanted to help, but didn't know how.

As Ted spent every night all week studying, Sally and Tommy decided to take matters into their own hands. They set up a lemonade stand in front of their house, determined to make a difference. When Saturday morning arrived, they sold lemonade to their neighbors and passersby, raising fifty-two dollars.

Meanwhile, Ted was too exhausted from staying up all night studying to even get out of bed on test day. He slept through the entire day, and when he finally woke up, he was devastated to learn that he had failed all his tests. He had to retake every single class.

But despite Ted's disappointment, Sally and Tommy were thrilled with the success of their lemonade stand. They felt proud knowing that they had made a difference, no matter how small, and were already planning their next fundraising event.

outline: Kim had an online diary that she wrote in daily.
Ruth's neighbor was religious.
Kim was very candid and put everything in the diary.
Ruth's neighbor invited Ruth over for a bible study.
One day, Kim was very mad at her boss and wrote about it.
Ruth reluctantly agreed.
Kim soon realized that Kim was not in Kim's diary, but on Facebook!
Ruth and her neighbor read several passages and discussed them.
Everyone saw Kim's post and Kim was fired the next day!
When Ruth and her neighbor were done, Ruth went home.
responses:
Kim had been writing in her online diary every day for years, pouring out her thoughts and feelings onto the digital page. She was very candid, sharing everything from her joys to her sorrows, and had grown used to the feeling of unloading her emotions into the virtual journal.

Ruth, Kim's best friend, had a neighbor who was deeply religious and often invited her over for bible study. Ruth had always been skeptical, but her neighbor's kind heart and genuine enthusiasm had eventually won her over. One day, Ruth reluctantly agreed to attend a bible study at her neighbor's house, hoping to support her friend.

Meanwhile, Kim was having a terrible day. Her boss had chewed her out in front of the entire office, and Kim was seething with anger. She sat down at her computer and began to write in her diary, unleashing her frustration and hurt onto the page.

But Kim made a mistake. She had forgotten to change the setting on her Facebook account, and instead of writing in her diary, she was posting her rant to her entire social network. The words went live, and before she could delete them, her boss had seen the post and was furious.

The next day, Kim was called into her boss's office and fired on the spot. Ruth was shocked when she heard the news, and couldn't believe that Kim's careless online behavior had cost her her job.

As for Ruth and her neighbor, they had a pleasant evening discussing the bible passages and enjoying each other's company. When they were done, Ruth headed home, feeling grateful for the friendship and the quiet evening. Little did she know that she had inadvertently played a role in Kim's downfall, reading Kim's online diary without her permission. Kim, meanwhile, was left to pick up the pieces of her shattered career, a bitter reminder of the dangers of careless online posting.

outline: Bobby got into the cheese puffs.
Julie was looking for some extra spending money.
Bobby's mother told Bobby to wait until after dinner, but Bobby couldn't.
Julie decided to open up a lemonade stand.
Bobby thought Bobby'd gotten away with it.
To Julie's delight the stand became quite popular.
Then Bobby realized Bobby had bright orange cheese all over Bobby's fingers.
The neighbors wanted to get a taste.
Bobby's mother didn't let Bobby have dessert that night as punishment.
At the end of the day Julie made 100 dollars.
responses:
Bobby couldn't resist the temptation of the cheese puffs, sneaking a handful from the bag while his mother was busy in the kitchen. She yelled out to him, "Bobby, wait until after dinner!" but he was too quick, and soon he had a telltale smudge of bright orange cheese on his fingers.

Meanwhile, Julie was on the hunt for some extra spending money. She had been saving up for weeks, and finally, she had a plan. She set up a lemonade stand in front of their house, and to her delight, it quickly became a popular spot for the neighbors to grab a cool drink on a hot summer day.

Bobby thought he had gotten away with his snack heist, but little did he know, his cheese-puffed fingers would soon ruin his plans. As the day went on and the lemonade stand attracted more and more customers, Bobby's mother noticed the bright orange smudges on his fingers. She raised an eyebrow and asked, "Bobby, what have you been up to?"

The neighbors, however, were fascinated by the strange orange substance and begged Julie to let them try some. Julie, happy to share her new business venture, handed out cups of lemonade and samples of the mysterious orange goo. The neighbors loved it, and soon, word spread about the magical lemonade stand.

At the end of the day, Julie counted her earnings and was thrilled to see she had made a whopping $100. Bobby, on the other hand, was grounded for the rest of the night as punishment for his snacking misdeed. But Julie didn't mind; she was too busy planning her next entrepreneurial adventure.

outline: Fernando wanted to capture the majestic beauty of the Alps.
Ashley bought a dogsled.
Fernando bought a ticket to go up the mountain.
Ashley wanted to test it out.
On top, it was so cold that Fernando's hands were shaking.
Ashley went outside in the snow.
When it was time to take the pictures Fernando wanted, Fernando couldn't.
Ashley climbed to the top of a hill.
Fernando all came shaky and unfocused.
Ashley then rode it to the bottom.
responses:
Fernando had always been captivated by the majestic beauty of the Alps, and he finally had the chance to capture it on camera. He bought a ticket to take the elevator to the top of the mountain, his heart racing with excitement. Meanwhile, Ashley had recently purchased a dogsled, and she couldn't wait to test it out.

As they reached the top, the biting cold hit Fernando like a slap in the face. His hands began to shake uncontrollably, making it impossible for him to hold his camera steady. Ashley, on the other hand, was thrilled to be outside in the snow, taking in the breathtaking view.

But when it was finally time to take the pictures Fernando had envisioned, his hands were still shaking too much to focus. Frustrated, he watched as Ashley climbed to the top of a nearby hill, her dogsled waiting patiently below. Undeterred, Fernando decided to try again, but his shaky hands only resulted in blurry, unfocused shots.

Ashley, meanwhile, had decided to take matters into her own hands. She climbed back down the hill, hopped onto her dogsled, and began to make her way down the mountain. Fernando, who had been trying to take pictures the whole time, finally gave up and joined her. As they rode the dogsled to the bottom, the wind in their faces and the snow crunching beneath their feet, they couldn't help but feel a sense of exhilaration and freedom.

outline: Lucy was eating in the dark.
Kim's lips felt dry.
Lucy was depressed.
Kim got some lip gloss that promised to make Kim's lips moist.
Lucy ate cold chicken and went to bed.
Kim slathered it on and rubbed Kim's lips together.
Lucy left the bones and the crumbs on the table.
Kim felt a horrible tingling and burning.
The next day Lucy's grandma scolded Lucy for leaving a mess.
Kim was allergic to the gloss!
responses:
Lucy sat alone in the dark, her fork scraping against the plate as she forced herself to eat the cold chicken in front of her. She was depressed, and the darkness seemed to match her mood perfectly. As she pushed the plate away, she got up and went to bed, leaving the bones and crumbs on the table.

The next day, Kim was getting ready for school when she noticed her lips felt dry and cracked. She remembered the new lip gloss she had gotten that promised to moisturize and plump her lips. She slathered it on, rubbing her lips together to spread the gloss evenly.

As she was about to leave for school, she ran into Lucy, who was still looking tired and down. Kim didn't notice Lucy's gloomy mood and instead worried about the gloss she had just applied. Suddenly, she felt a horrible tingling and burning sensation in her lips.

She quickly rinsed her lips with water, but the discomfort only intensified. She tried to ignore it, but the burning became too much to bear. She realized that she must be allergic to the gloss, and she frantically searched for some aloe vera or hydrocortisone cream to soothe her lips.

The next day, Lucy's grandma scolded her for leaving a mess on the table. Lucy felt guilty and ashamed, knowing that she had left a trail of crumbs and bones behind her. Kim, on the other hand, was still recovering from her allergic reaction, her lips still red and swollen.

As they sat down to eat dinner together, Lucy couldn't help but feel a pang of regret for leaving her grandma's house in such a state. She vowed to do better in the future, but for now, she just sat in silence, lost in thought.

outline: Kelly liked the boy that sat next to her in class.
Mary needed to find a dress to wear to her high school prom.
Kelly decided to ask the boy out one day.
Mary went to many stores and couldn't find a dress Mary liked.
The boy told Kelly that he wasn't interested, but the boy was just shy.
Finally, Mary found a blue dress that looked very pretty.
After a week the boy told Kelly the truth and the boy went out.
On prom night, everyone commented on how lovely Mary's dress looked.
Kelly and the boy are now dating and Kelly and the boy are both happy.
Mary felt happy that Mary had such a nice dress.
responses:
Kelly had a crush on the boy who sat next to her in class, but she couldn't muster the courage to ask him out. Meanwhile, her friend Mary was struggling to find the perfect dress for the upcoming high school prom. Kelly decided to take Mary shopping, hoping to take her mind off her own unrequited feelings.

As they visited store after store, Mary grew more and more frustrated. She just couldn't find a dress that made her feel like a princess. Kelly, trying to be supportive, encouraged Mary to keep looking. But little did Kelly know, she was about to take a chance of her own.

One day, Kelly mustered up the courage to ask the boy out. She nervously asked him if he'd like to go to prom with her, and to her surprise, she got a noncommittal answer. Kelly was crushed, thinking the boy had rejected her. But in reality, the boy was just shy and didn't know how to respond.

As the days went by, Kelly couldn't shake off the feeling that something was off. She finally got the truth out of the boy, who confessed that he wasn't interested in going to prom with her. Feeling embarrassed and disappointed, Kelly decided to move on.

But then, something amazing happened. Mary finally found the perfect dress - a stunning blue gown that made her look radiant. Kelly was thrilled for her friend and encouraged her to wear it to prom.

On prom night, Mary's dress stole the show. Everyone commented on how lovely she looked, and Kelly was happy to have played a part in her friend's success. As for Kelly, she was still feeling a bit down about her own prom experience.

However, fate had other plans. As Kelly was watching Mary dance with her date, she noticed a boy from their class looking at her with newfound interest. It turned out that the boy had been shy and didn't know how to approach Kelly, but he had been watching her from afar. Kelly and the boy started talking, and before long, they discovered that they had a lot in common.

As the night drew to a close, Kelly realized that she had found someone who actually liked her for who she was. She and the boy exchanged numbers, and soon they were dating. Kelly was over the moon with happiness, and she was grateful that things hadn't worked out with the boy she initially asked out.

Mary, still basking in the glory of her beautiful dress, felt happy that she had such a lovely outfit to wear to prom. And Kelly, now in a happy relationship, knew that sometimes things don't work out as planned, but that can lead to even better things.

outline: Holly had always wanted to pursue a Master's in Public Health.
Emma fell in love with Paul.
Holly worked hard academically to maintain a good grade point average.
Paul didn't feel the same for Emma and rejected Emma.
Holly also interned with the local Health Department to gain experience.
Emma's feelings were hurt, so Emma told the authorities.
During Holly's senior year Holly was able to apply to graduate schools.
Emma felt even worse when the authorities wouldn't listen.
Holly's internships and grades earned Holly a spot in graduate school!
Emma walked under a mattress for a year to show everyone Emma's feelings.
responses:
Holly had always been passionate about pursuing a Master's in Public Health. She worked hard academically, determined to maintain a good grade point average. As she entered her senior year, Holly also secured an internship with the local Health Department to gain valuable experience.

Meanwhile, Emma had fallen head over heels in love with Paul, but unfortunately, he didn't reciprocate her feelings. Crushed, Emma turned to the authorities, hoping they could help her deal with her broken heart. However, they refused to listen, leaving Emma feeling even more devastated.

As Holly continued to excel academically and professionally, she finally got accepted into the graduate program she had always dreamed of. Emma, still reeling from the rejection, decided to take a more unconventional approach to express her feelings. For the next year, she walked under a mattress every day, hoping to make a statement and show everyone her deep emotions.

Despite the challenges she faced, Holly remained focused on her goals and eventually earned a spot in the Master's in Public Health program. As she began her studies, she reflected on her own journey and the struggles Emma had faced. Holly realized that Emma's actions, though unusual, were a cry for help and a desperate attempt to be heard. In the end, Holly's academic achievements and Emma's unorthodox display of emotions served as a reminder that everyone's path to healing and happiness is unique.

outline: Tom wanted to buy a gun.
Stan styled his hair like a popular singer.
Tom decided to go to the shooting range.
Stan loved it when girls remarked on the resemblance.
Tom figured it would be a good place to learn about guns.
One day, news broke about the popular singer in an embarrassing scandal.
Everyone Tom talked to was an idiot.
Stan looked at himself in the mirror.
It made Tom rethink Tom's gun culture.
Then Stan got out a razor and shaved off Stan's hair.
responses:
Tom had been thinking about buying a gun for a while, and he finally decided to take the plunge. Before heading to the shooting range, he ran into his friend Stan, who had recently styled his hair to look just like a popular singer. Stan loved it when girls remarked on the resemblance, and he couldn't help but strike a pose every time someone compliments him.

Tom decided to go to the shooting range to learn more about guns, and Stan tagged along. As they arrived, Tom figured it would be a good chance to learn about gun safety and possibly even get a few tips from the pros. Stan, on the other hand, was more interested in drawing attention to himself and showing off his new haircut.

The next day, news broke that the popular singer whose hairstyle Stan had emulated was embroiled in a major scandal, and everyone Tom talked to seemed to be an idiot. They were all obsessed with the singer's personal life, and Tom found himself feeling annoyed by their lack of substance. Meanwhile, Stan looked at himself in the mirror, admiring his new look and basking in the admiration of others.

But as Tom watched Stan preening, something changed. It made Tom rethink his own fascination with gun culture. He realized that he didn't really know much about guns, and that his desire to own one was largely driven by a desire to feel powerful and macho. The more he thought about it, the more he felt like he was just following the crowd.

Just then, Stan got out a razor and shaved off his hair, revealing a completely bald head. Tom was taken aback, but he couldn't help but feel a sense of admiration for his friend's bold move. It was a reminder that people can change, and that sometimes the things we think we want most are actually holding us back. Tom decided to put his plans to buy a gun on hold, and instead focus on finding other ways to feel empowered and confident.

outline: Lagertha didn't like being told what to do.
Cody had really nice skin until he was about 8 years old.
Lagertha's mother told Lagertha to clean Lagertha's room.
Shortly after Cody's 8th birthday Cody's skin began to itch.
Lagertha refused, and went outside to play with Lagertha's friends.
As time went on Cody's skin began to peel and it would cause Cody pain.
When Lagertha returned at dusk, there was candy and roast lamb to eat.
Cody went to the Doctor who ordered tests which showed Cody had eczema.
Lagertha's mother forbid her to have any though, and sent her to her room.
Cody was then prescribed special lotions and now Cody's skin is better.
responses:
Lagertha was a feisty one, never taking kindly to being told what to do. Her mother, in a moment of exasperation, instructed Lagertha to clean her room. But Lagertha had other plans. She refused to budge, and instead, ran outside to play with her friends.

Meanwhile, Cody, a friend of Lagertha's, was dealing with a different issue. He had always had really nice skin until he was about 8 years old. But shortly after his birthday, his skin began to itch uncontrollably. As time went on, the itching turned into painful peeling, and Cody was miserable.

Lagertha returned home at dusk, only to find a surprise waiting for her - a spread of candy and roast lamb. But Cody was still struggling with his skin issues. His parents took him to see the doctor, who ran some tests and diagnosed Cody with eczema.

The doctor prescribed special lotions to help soothe Cody's skin, and with time, they began to work wonders. Cody's skin was no longer itchy and painful, and he could finally live a normal life.

But Lagertha's mother was not pleased with her daughter's defiance earlier that day. She forbade Lagertha from having any treats, and sent her to her room as punishment. Despite this, Lagertha couldn't help but feel a little jealous of Cody's newfound relief from his skin troubles. She realized that sometimes, it's better to listen to mom and take care of oneself.

outline: Gina's mom had been slowly packing her mother's things.
There was a clown at Eddy's friend's birthday party.
Gina's mom was taking her mother to Minnesota with Gina's mom.
Eddy couldn't get over how big the clown's feet were.
Gina helped Gina's mom every once in awhile.
Eddy asked his mom if people had to have big feet to be clowns.
Today Gina had nothing else to do.
Eddy's mom laughed at his question.
Gina decided to spend 3 hours helping with the packing.
Eddy's mom told Eddy that they wore big shoes, but they didn't have extra big feet.
responses:
Today Gina had nothing else to do, so she decided to spend 3 hours helping her mom with the packing. Her mom had been slowly packing Gina's grandmother's things, and Gina wanted to lend a hand. As she was lifting a box, her friend Eddy called her to ask if she wanted to go to his friend's birthday party. Gina agreed and promised to meet him there.

As they arrived at the party, Gina noticed that there was a clown making the kids laugh. Eddy was fascinated by the clown's big feet and asked his mom if people had to have big feet to be clowns. Gina's mom, who was there too, chuckled at the question. The clown, overhearing the conversation, approached them and started doing tricks.

After the party, Gina and Eddy walked back to Gina's house, where her mom was still packing. Gina's mom mentioned that she and Gina's grandmother were planning a trip to Minnesota together. Gina was thrilled and asked if she could come along. Her mom said yes, and Gina started helping her with the packing again.

As they packed, Gina's mom told her about all the things they would do in Minnesota, from visiting the lakes to trying local cuisine. Eddy, who had stopped by to say goodbye, couldn't get over how big the clown's feet were. Gina's mom laughed and explained that clowns wore big shoes, but that didn't mean they had extra big feet. Eddy was satisfied with the answer and left with a big smile on his face.

outline: Nellie fell asleep on the sand at the beach.
Charles was about twenty years older than the kids on the court.
Nellie dozed peacefully for a few hours.
But Charles knew moves with a basketball they couldn't imagine.
But when Nellie woke, Nellie panicked.
During a game this summer the score was tied.
Nellie was covered head-to-toe in heavy wet sand!
Charles had the ball and Charles' team needed one basket to win.
Nellie's little brother had buried Nellie in sand while Nellie slept!
Charles pretended to be nervous and then sunk a jump shot!
responses:
Nellie had spent the entire day at the beach, soaking up the sun and playing in the waves. As the afternoon wore on, she collapsed onto the sand, exhausted, and fell asleep. Charles, a seasoned basketball player, happened to be passing by with his friends, and they were on their way to play a pickup game on the nearby court.

As Nellie dozed peacefully for a few hours, Charles and his friends took to the court, their sneakers squeaking on the pavement. Charles, who was about twenty years older than the kids on the court, showed off some impressive moves with the basketball, leaving his friends in awe.

But when Nellie finally woke up, she panicked. She was covered head-to-toe in heavy, wet sand! She frantically tried to brush it off, but it only seemed to get worse. That's when she realized her little brother had buried her in sand while she slept.

Meanwhile, on the court, the score was tied and Charles' team was in a tight spot. Charles had the ball and his team needed one basket to win. He pretended to be nervous, bouncing the ball a few times before taking a deep breath and sinking a jump shot. The crowd erupted in cheers as Charles' team won the game.

As Nellie struggled to free herself from the sand, she couldn't help but watch the celebration on the court. She laughed at the absurdity of it all, feeling a mix of relief and embarrassment. Charles, noticing her predicament, strolled over to offer her a hand, and together they laughed about the unexpected turn of events. Despite the chaos, Nellie left the beach that day with a newfound appreciation for the power of a good jump shot.

outline: Last summer was incredibly hot.
Tim was trying to wash dishes.
My friend Dalton spent almost the whole summer in Dalton's house.
Tim noticed the water wouldn't drain.
There was one day where Dalton spent all day at my house though.
Tim tried using a plunger to fix it.
It was the day that Dalton's air conditioner broke.
After a bit of trying the water started to leave.
I sort of wish Dalton's air conditioner had broken more often.
Tim plunged a bit more just to make sure.
responses:
Last summer was incredibly hot, and Tim was trying to escape the heat by washing dishes in his small kitchen. His friend Dalton, on the other hand, had spent almost the whole summer holed up in his own house, refusing to venture out into the sweltering heat.

As Tim scrubbed away at a particularly stubborn plate, he noticed that the water wasn't draining properly. He tried to shake his head clear of the thought, thinking it was just his imagination playing tricks on him, but the problem persisted.

One day, Dalton surprised Tim by spending all day at his house, lounging on the couch and complaining about the heat. As it turned out, Dalton's air conditioner had broken that very morning, and he was desperate for a break from the oven-like temperatures.

Feeling a sense of solidarity with his friend, Tim decided to take on the clogged sink himself. He fetched the plunger and, with a bit of effort, managed to dislodge the blockage. As the water started to drain, he felt a sense of satisfaction wash over him.

After a bit of trying, the water finally left the sink, and Tim turned his attention back to the dishes. He plunged a bit more just to make sure everything was clear, and then he was done.

As he rinsed the last dish and put it away, Tim couldn't help but think that maybe Dalton's air conditioner had broken a little too often. But for that one day, at least, it had brought them closer together. And as he looked out the window at the now-cloudy sky, he felt grateful for the unexpected respite from the heat.

outline: Frank was a pitcher for a MLB team.
Charles notices his hands are a little dirty after working all day.
But last season Frank got hurt and had to receive Tommy John surgery.
Charles decides to wash them when Charles gets home.
Frank was scared Frank would not pitch again.
Charles washes Charles' hands thoroughly.
But after a year and a half Frank came back to pitch again.
Charles' hands are clean now.
Frank was once again a pitcher for a MLB team.
Charles is glad Charles washed Charles' hands.
responses:
Frank was a talented pitcher for a Major League Baseball team, but his career was put on hold after a devastating injury last season. The Tommy John surgery he underwent was a long and grueling process, and Frank had his doubts about ever taking the mound again.

As Charles, a mechanic, returned home from a long day of work, he couldn't help but notice the dirt and grime on his hands. He decided to wash them thoroughly, making sure to get rid of all the grease and dust.

Meanwhile, Frank was going through his own struggles. The fear of never pitching again was a constant companion, and he couldn't shake the feeling that his career was over.

But fate had other plans. After a year and a half of rehabilitation, Frank made a remarkable recovery and was cleared to return to the mound. He was nervous but determined, and with each passing game, he regained his confidence and form.

Back at home, Charles was thrilled to see that his hands were now clean and sparkling. He was glad he had taken the time to wash them thoroughly, and it was a small reminder that even in the darkest of times, a little bit of effort could go a long way.

As Frank took the mound once again, he knew that he had been given a second chance. And as he threw his first pitch, he felt a sense of redemption wash over him. He was back, and he was better than ever.

Charles, watching the game on TV, couldn't help but feel a sense of pride and accomplishment. He was glad he had washed his hands, and he was glad Frank was back on the mound, doing what he loved. It was a small victory, but it was a reminder that with hard work and determination, anything was possible.

outline: Daniel loves filling the bird feeders at his home.
Madi was hanging out with her little sister while mom took a shower.
Daniel enjoys seeing the wide variety of birds that they attract.
Madi glanced over to the table and noticed a pair of scissors.
The birds glare at Daniel through the window if they are not fed.
Then Madi looked at her sister's hair and saw how long it was getting.
When Daniel fills the feeders, the birds alert their friends by chirping.
Madi grabbed the scissors and cut Emma's hair to Emma's jawline.
After fresh food is supplied, Daniel loves seeing the birds so happy.
When mom got downstairs, she was sad to see her sister's first haircut.
responses:
Here is the short story:

As Daniel filled the bird feeders at his home, he couldn't help but feel a sense of joy. He loved watching the wide variety of birds that they attracted, and he took great care to ensure they always had a full supply of food. Meanwhile, Madi was hanging out with her little sister, Emma, while their mom took a shower upstairs.

Madi glanced over to the table and noticed a pair of scissors sitting there. She had an idea, and she quickly grabbed them. Emma's hair was getting long, and Madi thought it was time for a haircut. Without hesitation, Madi began to cut Emma's hair, snipping away until it reached Emma's jawline.

As Madi cut, the birds outside seemed to sense that something was amiss. They began to chirp and alert their friends to the commotion inside. Daniel, unaware of the sudden haircut, continued to fill the feeders, oblivious to the hubbub.

When mom got downstairs, she was taken aback by Emma's new look. She had been looking forward to giving Emma her first haircut, and instead, she was met with a haircut that was a bit more... drastic. Emma, on the other hand, seemed to be enjoying her newfound independence, and Madi beamed with pride at her handiwork.

Daniel, still busy with the bird feeders, looked up to see the commotion and smiled. He loved seeing the birds so happy, and he knew that the fresh food would bring them even more joy. As the family sat down to discuss the sudden haircut, Daniel couldn't help but feel grateful for the little moments that made life so special – like filling the bird feeders and watching the birds thrive.

outline: Alex was told by his parents to not mess with their computer at all.
Lucy was eating in the dark.
One day when Alex's parents had to run errands Alex was left at home.
Lucy was depressed.
Alex decided to go on Alex's parents computer since Alex's parents weren't home.
Lucy ate cold chicken and went to bed.
Alex ended up messing up his parents' passwords.
Lucy left the bones and the crumbs on the table.
Alex's parents came home and saw what Alex had done they grounded Alex.
The next day Lucy's grandma scolded Lucy for leaving a mess.
responses:
Alex trudged through the front door, feeling a mix of excitement and nervousness. His parents had left for errands, leaving him home alone for the first time. As he walked into the kitchen, he noticed Lucy, a family friend, sitting in the dark, eating something. She seemed lost in thought, and Alex could sense the weight of her depression.

Despite his parents' warning to stay away from their computer, Alex couldn't resist the temptation. He crept into the study, his heart racing, and booted up the machine. Lucy, oblivious to his actions, continued eating in the dark.

Alex's curiosity got the better of him, and he started exploring his parents' files. He stumbled upon their passwords, and his curiosity turned into mischief. He changed them, thinking it would be a fun prank. Little did he know, it would have serious consequences.

Later that evening, Lucy finished her cold chicken dinner and headed to bed, leaving the bones and crumbs on the table. Alex, still enthralled by the computer, didn't notice.

The next morning, Alex's parents returned, and their faces fell when they saw the state of their computer. Alex's heart sank as he realized he had messed up big time. His parents scolded him, grounding him for his actions.

The following day, Lucy's grandma visited, and Lucy was still reeling from her depression. As they sat down to eat, Lucy's grandma scolded her for leaving a mess, pointing to the crumbs and bones on the table. Lucy looked down, feeling guilty and ashamed. Alex, still grounded, watched from afar, regretting his decision to play with his parents' computer.

outline: Anna went on a class trip.
